thread.title: Russia soccer official shrugs at British gov't World Cup boycott: report

title: Russia soccer official shrugs at British gov't World Cup boycott: report

organizations.name: interfax news agency cited russian football union

text: March 14, 2018 / 3:26 PM / Updated 2 hours ago Russia soccer official shrugs at British gov't World Cup boycott: report Reuters Staff 1 Min Read MOSCOW (Reuters) - It does not matter if British officials boycott the soccer World Cup, which will be hosted by Russia, Interfax news agency cited Russian Football Union Vice President Nikita Simonyan as saying on Wednesday. Soccer Football - 2018 FIFA World Cup Draw - State Kremlin Palace, Moscow, Russia - December 1, 2017 Nikita Simonyan pulls out Germany during the draw REUTERS/Kai Pfaffenbach “That’s their problem. What matters is whether the team comes, and it wants to come. The World Cup is once every four years,” Simonyan said. Reporting by Andrew Osborn; Writing by Polina Ivanova; Editing by Christian Lowe
